body:
Sorry I forgot, but to reproduce the issue I just have to run :
"python -m deeplabcut"
Hey @clementpouget, could you tell me if this answer works for you? https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/682#issuecomment-882325252

Hey Jeylau, the change allows me to open the GUI using "python -m deeplabcut". But this time, when I get to the image labelling step, I get the same error again:
Code output

(DEEPLABCUT) C:\Users\C4_admin>python -m deeplabcut 2021-07-26 13:07:52.712752: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_110.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_110.dll not found 2021-07-26 13:07:52.712987: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine. Starting GUI... Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\labeling_toolbox.py", line 698, in browseDir ) = self.image_panel.drawplot( File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\labeling_toolbox.py", line 189, in drawplot self.toolbar = NavigationToolbar(self.canvas) File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_wx.py", line 1377, in __init__ NavigationToolbar2.__init__(self, canvas) File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backend_bases.py", line 2636, in __init__ self._init_toolbar() File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_wx.py", line 1404, in _init_toolbar bitmap=_load_bitmap(image_file + ".png"), File "C:\Users\C4_admin\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_wx.py", line 1243, in _load_bitmap bmp = wx.Bitmap(bmpFilename) wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "strcmp(setlocale(0, 0), "C") == 0" failed at ..\..\src\common\intl.cpp(1694) in wxLocale::GetInfo(): You probably called setlocale() directly instead of using wxLocale and now there is a mismatch between C/C++ and Windows locale. Things are going to break, please only change locale by creating wxLocale objects to avoid this!

@clementpouget there is another issue in your top post:

> Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_110.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_110.dll not found

this means you have the wrong CUDA installed; https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/installation.html#gpu-support

and wxPython >4.0.7post2 will cause this issue, so please downgrade: `pip install -U wxPython<4.1.0`

issue.title: mismatch between C/C++ and Windows locale

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After the program finished training, when I tried evaluate the network I got this error massage:  
←[1;31mwxAssertionError←[0m: C++ assertion "strcmp(setlocale(LC_ALL, NULL), "C") == 0" failed at ..\..\src\common\intl.cpp(1579) in wxLocale::GetInfo(): You probably called setlocale() directly instead of using wxLocale and now there is a mismatch between C/C++ and Windows locale.
Things are going to break, please only change locale by creating wxLocale objects to avoid this!

### Operating System

Windows

### DeepLabCut version

VERSION 2.2: Multi-animal pose estimation and tracking with DeepLabCut.

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output


issue.title: DeepLabCut GUI won't show output

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I'm using DLC GUI to track human movement. 

I encountered 2 issues:
1. Output can't be displayed. An error that has to do with a mismatch between C/C++ and Windows locale shows up (see Relevant log output).
2. There is a warning regarding using GPU.

I'd be happy to get some assistance in the matter.
Thanks!

### Operating System

Windows

### DeepLabCut version

version 2.2.1.1

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a project using GUI.
2. Extract frames - default.
3. Label Data -> Label Frames -> worked as expected.
4. Label Data ->Check Labels! -> shows locale error.
5. Anytime an output is requested the locale error shows again. For example in Evaluate->Optional: Plot 3 test maps, or Create videos->Bluid skeleton.

### Relevant log output

```shell
return wx.Bitmap(str(cbook._get_data_path('images', filename)))
wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "strcmp(setlocale(LC_ALL, NULL), "C") == 0" failed at ..\..\src\common\intl.cpp(1579) in wxLocale::GetInfo(): You probably called setlocale() directly instead of using wxLocale and now there is a mismatch between C/C++ and Windows locale.
Things are going to break, please only change locale by creating wxLocale objects to avoid this!
```


### Anything else?

There is an error when starting the GUI regarding the GPU use:

2022-07-26 19:49:59.225377: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_110.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_110.dll not found
2022-07-26 19:49:59.233256: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
